name: CogniForge - Production Dev Environment
// Use the docker-compose file to define the services for the dev environment.
dockerComposeFile: // The primary service VS Code will attach to.
service: // Ensure both the web and AI services are started automatically.
runServices: // The standard workspace folder for Codespaces, mounted automatically.
workspaceFolder: // --- ARCHITECTURAL FIX: Unify Build & Runtime User Environment ---
// 1. Run the container as 'root'. This aligns the runtime user with the
//    build-time user, giving devcontainer features the correct permissions.
remoteUser: // 2. Force the HOME environment variable. This ensures all tools, including
//    features and VS Code, use '/root' as their home, preventing permission
remoteEnv: // Set to 'false' to ensure the CMD from the Dockerfile (e.g., starting Gunicorn)
// is executed, rather than being overridden by the dev container's default.
overrideCommand: // Commands to run once after the container is created. Executes as 'root'.
postCreateCommand: bash -c 'pip install --no-cache-dir --upgrade pip && pip install --no-cache-dir ruff black pytest && chown -R root:root /root/.config || true'
portsAttributes: // These features will now initialize correctly under the unified 'root' user.
